answers.answer: Hi!Generally polyhydroamnios or increased amniotic fluid is due to diabetes in mother causing high glucose in fetal blood and thus more fetal urine formation and more amniotic fluid. It can also be due to maternal heart or kidney condition. Down syndrome and Edward syndrome in fetus too can cause this. It can also be due to fetal-fetal transfusion syndrome in twin pregnancy where the twins share a single placenta—find out if this is the cause. Dietary salt restriction and maternal blood glucose checking should be done first. Then other tests to rule out the other mentioned conditions need to be done. Since a confirmed diagnosis cannot be given on net please discuss these possibilities with your friend’s gynecologist once. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: Is there any solution for this problem? Because a friend of mine is about 34 or 35 weeks pregnant and when she had her check up yesterday the doctor said that she has too high amniotic fluid andher baby has a water in the head heart and stomach. Does anyone know what will be the causes of her problem and what will happen with the baby?
title: Too high amniotic fluid and the baby has a water inside the head, heart and tummy.
